name: qradar
label: IBM QRadar
description: IBM QRadar is an enterprise security information and event management (SIEM) product. Fortinet FortiSOSR connector for IBM QRadar allows user to invoke QRadar API, perform Ariel Queries and operations like Get Offense,related events,update and close offenses.

fields.title: Address
fields.name: address
fields.description: Specify the IP address of the QRadar server from where the connector gets offenses information and to which you connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API Token
fields.name: token
fields.description: Specify the API token to access the QRadar server to which you connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API Version
fields.name: api_version
fields.description: Specify the version of the QRadar API to be used for performing automated operations. By default, this is set to 14.0.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this is set to True.

operations.title: Get Offenses from QRadar
operations.description: Retrieves a list of offenses from the QRadar server based on the filter string that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter String
parameters.description: Specify the filter string based on which you want to retrieve the list of offenses from QRadar. For example, assigned_to="admin".
parameters.name: filter_string

operations.title: Make an Ariel Query to QRadar
operations.description: Executes an Ariel query on the QRadar server. QRadar uses the Ariel Query Language (AQL) to search for offenses or events based on query parameters.

parameters.title: Ariel Search String
parameters.description: Specify the Ariel query that you want to run on the QRadar server.
parameters.name: search_string

operations.title: Get Offense Closing Reasons
operations.description: Retrieves a list of closing reasons associated with all offenses from the QRadar server.

operations.title: Get Offense Types
operations.description: Retrieves a list containing IDs of all the offense types from the QRadar server.

operations.title: Get Offense Notes
operations.description: Retrieves a list of notes associated with a specified offense in QRadar based on the offense ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Offense ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the offense whose associated notes you want to retrieve from the QRadar server.
parameters.name: offense_id

operations.title: Close Offense
operations.description: Closes an offense on the QRadar server based on the offense ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Offense ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the offense that you want to close on the QRadar server.
parameters.name: offense_id

parameters.title: Offense Closing Reason - ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the offense closing reason using which you want to close the offense on the QRadar server.
parameters.name: offense_close_id

parameters.title: Closure Note
parameters.name: closure_note
parameters.description: (Optional) Note that you want to associate with the offense that you want to close on the QRadar server.

operations.title: Create Note
operations.description: Creates a note for a specified offense in QRadar based on the offense ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Offense ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the offense for which you want to create a note on the QRadar server.
parameters.name: offense_id

parameters.title: Closure Note
parameters.description: Specify the text of the closure note that you want to create for the specified offense on the QRadar server.
parameters.name: closure_note

operations.title: Get Events Related to an Offense
operations.description: Retrieves details of events associated with a QRadar offense, from the QRadar server, based on the QRadar offense ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: QRadar Offense ID
parameters.description: Specify the Offense ID based on which you want to retrieve events from QRadar.
parameters.name: offense_id

parameters.title: Offense Start Time
parameters.description: Specify the number of milliseconds since the epoch from the offense was started.
parameters.name: start_time

parameters.title: Offense Last Update Time
parameters.description: Specify the number of milliseconds since the epoch from the offense was last modified.
parameters.name: last_updated_time

parameters.title: Max Events to return
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of events that this operation should return.
parameters.name: max_results

operations.title: Get Source IP Addresses
operations.description: Retrieves IP address details associated with source address IDs from the QRadar server, based on the source address IDs that you have specified

parameters.title: Source Address Ids
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of source addresses based on which you want to retrieve IP address details from the QRadar server. For example, [3,4,5].
parameters.name: source_address_ids

operations.title: Get Destination IP Addresses
operations.description: Retrieves IP address details associated with the destination address IDs from the QRadar server, based on the destination address IDs that you have specified

parameters.title: Destination Address Ids
parameters.description: IDs of destination addresses based on which you want to retrieve IP address details from the QRadar server. For example, [3,4,5].
parameters.name: destination_address_ids

operations.title: Invoke QRadar REST API
operations.description: Invokes a function to Get or Post an API endpoint on the QRadar server.

parameters.title: Endpoint
parameters.description: Specifies the REST endpoint. For example, /siem/offenses.
parameters.name: endpoint

parameters.title: Request Method
parameters.description: Select the request method. You can choose between GET, POST, or PATCH. If you select GET, then you should specify the Request Parameters parameter. In the Request parameters parameter, specify the request parameters for the specified endpoint. If you select POST, then you can specify either the Request Parameters in JSON Format or the Request Payload in JSON Format parameter. In these parameters, specify either the request parameters or the request JSON payload for the specified endpoint. If you select PATCH, then you can specify either the Request Parameters in JSON Format or the Request Payload in JSON Format parameter. In these parameters, specify either the request parameters or the request JSON payload for the specified endpoint.
parameters.name: method

GET.title: Request Parameters
GET.description: Provide the request parameters for the above endpoint that you have specified
GET.name: request_parameters

Request Parameters.title: Request Parameters in JSON Format
Request Parameters.description: Provide the request parameters for the above endpoint that you have specified
Request Parameters.name: request_parameters

Request Payload.title: Request Payload in JSON Format
Request Payload.description: Provide the request json payload for the above endpoint that you have specified
Request Payload.name: request_payload

Request Parameters.title: Request Parameters in JSON Format
Request Parameters.description: Provide the request parameters for the above endpoint that you have specified
Request Parameters.name: request_parameters

Request Payload.title: Request Payload in JSON Format
Request Payload.description: Provide the request json payload for the above endpoint that you have specified
Request Payload.name: request_payload

parameters.title: Headers in json format
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional JSON formatted headers. The following headers are already added by the connector: 'Accept': 'application/JSON', 'Content-Type': 'application/JSON', 'SEC': <token>, 'Version': <api_version>,
parameters.name: headers

operations.title: Manipulate Reference Set Content
operations.description: Adds or deletes the content that you have specified from a reference set on QRadar.

parameters.title: Request Method
parameters.description: Select the request method option of the operation that you want to perform on the specified reference set in QRadar. You can choose from following options: Retrieves Value: Specify values in the following field: Reference Set Name: Specify the name of the reference set from which to retrieve the content in QRadar. Add Value: Specify values in the following field: Reference Set Name: Specify the name of the reference set in which to add the content in QRadar. Value: Specify the value to add to the specified reference set. Delete Value: Specify values in the following field: Reference Set Name: Specify the name of the reference set from which to delete the content in QRadar. Value: Specify the value to delete from the specified reference set.
parameters.name: method

Retrieves Value.title: Reference Set Name
Retrieves Value.tooltip: Name of the reference set in which you want manipulate the content
Retrieves Value.description: Specify the name of the reference set to be used for this operation based on the option you have specified in the Request Method. If you choose Add Value as the Request Method, then this operation will add the specified value to the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Delete Value as the Request Method, then this operation will delete the specified value from the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Retrieves Value as the Request Method, then this operation will retrieve the values of the reference set you have specified in this field.
Retrieves Value.name: name

Add Value.title: Reference Set Name
Add Value.tooltip: Name of the reference set in which you want manipulate the content
Add Value.description: Specify the name of the reference set to be used for this operation based on the option you have specified in the Request Method. If you choose Add Value as the Request Method, then this operation will add the specified value to the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Delete Value as the Request Method, then this operation will delete the specified value from the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Retrieves Value as the Request Method, then this operation will retrieve the values of the reference set you have specified in this field.
Add Value.name: name

Add Value.title: Value
Add Value.tooltip: Value that you want to add or remove from the specified reference set. You must specify the value in this field if you have chosen Add Value or Delete Value as the Request Method.
Add Value.description: Specify the value that you want to add or remove from the specified reference set. You must specify the value in this field if you have chosen Add Value or Delete Value as the Request Method.
Add Value.name: value

Delete Value.title: Reference Set Name
Delete Value.tooltip: Name of the reference set in which you want manipulate the content
Delete Value.description: Specify the name of the reference set to be used for this operation based on the option you have specified in the Request Method. If you choose Add Value as the Request Method, then this operation will add the specified value to the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Delete Value as the Request Method, then this operation will delete the specified value from the reference set you have specified in this field. If you choose Retrieves Value as the Request Method, then this operation will retrieve the values of the reference set you have specified in this field.
Delete Value.name: name

Delete Value.title: Value
Delete Value.tooltip: Value that you want to add or remove from the specified reference set. You must specify the value in this field if you have chosen Add Value or Delete Value as the Request Method.
Delete Value.description: Specify the value that you want to add or remove from the specified reference set. You must specify the value in this field if you have chosen Add Value or Delete Value as the Request Method.
Delete Value.name: value

operations.title: Get Assets Properties
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of available asset properties or specific available asset properties from QRadar based on input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of asset properties to be returned by this operation in the response. Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: Specify the parameters to be used to filter (restrict) the list of asset properties to be returned by this operation in the response.
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used to restrict the list of asset properties in the response based on the filter query specified.
parameters.name: filter_string
parameters.placeholder: field_one = 'some_string' and field_two > 42 or not field_three in (1, 2, 3)

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

operations.title: Get Assets
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of all available assets or specific available assets from QRadar based on input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: Specify the parameters to be used to filter (restrict) the list of assets to be returned by this operation in the response.
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used to restrict the list of assets in the response based on the filter query specified.
parameters.name: filter_string
parameters.placeholder: field_one = 'some_string' and field_two > 42 or not field_three in (1, 2, 3)

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of assets to be returned by this operation in the response. Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.description: Specify the fields using which you want to sort the response. Specify the negative (-) sign to sort the results in descending order and the positive sign (+) to sort in ascending order.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify on which field you would like to sort the response. Specify negative sign to sort in descending order and positive sign to sort in ascending order.
parameters.name: query.sort

operations.title: Update Asset
operations.description: Updates the attributes of a specific asset on the QRadar server based on the asset ID and asset properties you have specified. Note: You can retrieve the list of asset properties using the 'Get Assets Properties' operation.

parameters.title: Asset ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the asset whose properties you want to update on QRadar.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the asset to update on Qradar
parameters.name: path.asset_id

parameters.title: Asset Properties
parameters.description: Specify a JSON dictionary with the asset properties that you want to update in the specified asset you want to update on QRadar
parameters.tooltip: Specify a JSON dictionary with the asset properties to update on Qradar
parameters.name: body.asset

parameters.title: Content Type
parameters.description: This is a system field that cannot be edited.
parameters.tooltip: System field, cannot be edited
parameters.name: content_type

operations.title: Get Cases
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of all cases or specific cases from QRadar based on input parameters specified. Note: This action is supported on QRadar API version 7.0 and later.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: Specify the parameters to be used to filter (restrict) the list of cases to be returned by this operation in the response.
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used to restrict the list of cases in the response based on the filter query specified.
parameters.name: filter_string
parameters.placeholder: field_one = 'some_string' and field_two > 42 or not field_three in (1, 2, 3)

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of cases to be returned by this operation in the response. Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.name: max_results

operations.title: Create Case
operations.description: Creates a new case on QRadar based on the case properties you have specified. Note: This action is supported on QRadar API version 7.0 and later.

parameters.title: Case Properties
parameters.description: Specify a JSON dictionary with the case properties using which you want to create the case on QRadar.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a JSON dictionary with the case properties to create a case on Qradar
parameters.name: body.case

parameters.title: Content Type
parameters.description: This is a system field that cannot be edited.
parameters.tooltip: System field, cannot be edited
parameters.name: content_type

operations.title: Get Reference Tables
operations.description: Retrieves a detailed list of all reference tables or specific reference tables from QRadar based on input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: Specify the parameters to be used to filter (restrict) the list of reference tables to be returned by this operation in the response.
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used to restrict the list of reference tables in the response based on the filter query specified.
parameters.name: filter_string
parameters.placeholder: field_one = 'some_string' and field_two > 42 or not field_three in (1, 2, 3)

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum count of reference tables to be returned by this operation in the response. Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

operations.title: Delete or Purge Reference Table
operations.description: Deletes a specific reference table and optionally purges its content from QRadar based on the reference table name you have specified. Note: You can retrieve names and details of reference tables using the 'Get Reference Tables' operation.

parameters.title: Reference Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the reference table that you want to delete from QRadar.
parameters.tooltip: The name of the reference table to delete or purge
parameters.name: path.name

parameters.title: Purge Table
parameters.description: Select the 'true' option from the Purge Table drop-down list if you want to have the contents of the specified reference table to be purged from QRadar, i.e., in this case, the structure of the specified reference table is retained. Select the 'false' (default) option from the Purge Table drop-down list to purge the contents of the specified reference table, i.e., in this case, the specified reference table is completely removed.
parameters.tooltip: This indicates if the reference table should have its contents purged (if the value is true), keeping the reference table structure. If the value is false, or not specified the reference table is removed completely.
parameters.name: query.purge_only

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Namespace
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the namespace of the reference table that you want to delete from QRadar. By default, it is 'SHARED' for 'admin' users and 'TENANT' for 'tenant' users. Note: If you select true from the Purge Table drop-down list, i.e., purge_only is set to true, then the default is 'SHARED' for all users.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the namespace, Default is SHARED for admin users and TENANT for tenant users. If purge_only is true, the default is SHARED for all users.
parameters.name: query.namespace

operations.title: Get Table Elements
operations.description: Retrieves the record details (elements) of a specific reference table based on the reference table name you have specified. Note: You can retrieve names and details of reference tables using the 'Get Reference Tables' operation.

parameters.title: Reference Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the reference table whose record details (elements) you want to retrieve from QRadar.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the reference table to fetch from Qradar
parameters.name: path.name

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum count of table elements to be returned by this operation in the response. Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to restrict the number of elements that are returned in the list to a specified range. The list is indexed starting at zero.
parameters.name: max_results

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Namespace
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the namespace of the reference table whose record details (elements) you want to retrieve from QRadar. By default, it is 'SHARED' for 'admin' users and 'TENANT' for 'tenant' users. Note: If you select true from the Purge Table drop-down list, i.e., purge_only is set to true, then the default is 'SHARED' for all users.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the namespace, Default is SHARED for admin users and TENANT for tenant users. If purge_only is true, the default is SHARED for all users.
parameters.name: query.namespace

operations.title: Add or Update Table Element
operations.description: Adds or updates an element in the specified reference table based on the reference table name, outer key, inner key, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Reference Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the reference table in which you want to add or update the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the reference table to add or update an element in.
parameters.name: path.name

parameters.title: Outer Key
parameters.description: Specify the outer key in which you want to add or update the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the outer key in which you want to add or update the element.
parameters.name: query.outer_key

parameters.title: Inner Key
parameters.description: Specify the inner key in which you want to add or update the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the inner key in which you want to add or update the element.
parameters.name: query.inner_key

parameters.title: Value
parameters.description: Specify the value of the element that you want to add or update in the specified reference table. Note: Date values must be represented in Unix Epoch milliseconds.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the element to add or update in the reference table. Note: Date values must be represented in Unix Epoch milliseconds, eg: 1671706076483
parameters.name: query.value

parameters.title: Domain ID
parameters.description: (Optional) In the case of MSSP setups, you can specify the domain ID to be set for the 'value' you have specified in the 'Value' field. If the 'Domain ID' field is null, then the shared domain is used.
parameters.tooltip: For MSSP setups, it sets the domain id for the value to be specified. If null, the shared domain will be used.
parameters.name: query.domain_id

parameters.title: Element Source
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the source of the specified element that you want to add or update in the specified table. By default, this is set to 'FortiSOAR'.
parameters.tooltip: An indication of where the data originated. The default value is 'FortiSOAR'
parameters.name: query.source

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Namespace
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the namespace of the reference table in which you want to add or update the specified element. By default, it is 'SHARED' for 'admin' users and 'TENANT' for 'tenant' users. Note: If you select true from the Purge Table drop-down list, i.e., purge_only is set to true, then the default is 'SHARED' for all users
parameters.tooltip: Specify the namespace, Default is SHARED for admin users and TENANT for tenant users. If purge_only is true, the default is SHARED for all users.
parameters.name: query.namespace

operations.title: Delete Table Element
operations.description: Specify the element to be deleted from a reference table on Qradar based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Reference Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the reference table from which you want to delete the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the reference table to remove element from.
parameters.name: path.name

parameters.title: Outer Key
parameters.description: Specify the outer key from which you want to delete the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the outer key in which you want to delete the element.
parameters.name: path.outer_key

parameters.title: Inner Key
parameters.description: Specify the inner key from which you want to delete the specified element.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the inner key from which you want to delete the element.
parameters.name: path.inner_key

parameters.title: value
parameters.description: Specify the value of the element that you want to delete from the specified reference table. Note: Date values must be represented in Epoch milliseconds.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the element to delete. Note: Date values must be represented in Epoch milliseconds
parameters.name: query.value

parameters.title: Domain ID
parameters.description: (Optional) In the case of MSSP setups, you can specify the domain ID to be set for the 'value' you have specified in the 'Value' field. If the 'Domain ID' field is null, then the shared domain is used.
parameters.tooltip: For MSSP setups, it sets the domain id for the value to be specified. If null, the shared domain will be used.
parameters.name: query.domain_id

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the fields to be returned in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets, and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.tooltip: Use this parameter to specify which fields you would like to get back in the response. Fields that are not named are excluded. Specify subfields in brackets and multiple fields in the same object are separated by commas.
parameters.name: query.fields

parameters.title: Namespace
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the namespace of the reference table from which you want to delete the specified element. By default, it is 'SHARED' for 'admin' users and 'TENANT' for 'tenant' users. Note: If you select true from the Purge Table drop-down list, i.e., purge_only is set to true, then the default is 'SHARED' for all users
parameters.tooltip: Specify the namespace, Default is SHARED for admin users and TENANT for tenant users. If purge_only is true, the default is SHARED for all users.
parameters.name: query.namespace

operations.title: Fetch Offenses from QRadar
operations.description: Retrieves a list of offenses from the QRadar server based on the filter string, start datetime, and updated datetime that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter String
parameters.description: Specify the filter string based on which you want to retrieve the list of offenses from QRadar. For example, assigned_to="admin".
parameters.name: filter_string

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.description: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: start_time
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.
